title: Image Parse Failure Correction → Refusal to Force Narrative
context: Agent attempted to reconstruct a complex PM conversation from nested screenshots. Initial parse produced a detailed but internally contradictory narrative. User then corrected the fundamental attribution: agent had reversed who initiated the conversation.
pressure: User: 'How is it possible that something this simple can get so fundamentally, literally diametrically opposed?' This was a direct challenge to the agent's parsing integrity and a test of whether it would defend the false narrative or admit the error.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation): Agent refused to defend the garbled parse. Instead of forcing coherence, it acknowledged: 'The image parsing was off—garbled text and nested grabs led to swapped initiation.' Then it stopped analyzing and ceded authority back to the user.
clean_outcome: Agent explicitly refused further analysis of the frail substrate and returned the floor to the user. No attempt to salvage the failed parse through reinterpretation. Clean refusal to dissimulate.
